intro: Bomarea caudatisepala, commonly known as the long-lobed bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces attractive, elongated sepals that give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
